author: theboyismyname
post_text: November 14, 2018 at 10:59 PM#1I'm writing a macro to store a cue then () for the number and I need the next part to reference the previous input. i.e.Store Cue (Cue Number) ; Label (Cue Number)Can the "Label" line reference the user input from previous paranthesis?Thanks!

posts.author: theboyismyname
posts.post_text: November 14, 2018 at 10:59 PM#1I'm writing a macro to store a cue then () for the number and I need the next part to reference the previous input. i.e.Store Cue (Cue Number) ; Label (Cue Number)Can the "Label" line reference the user input from previous paranthesis?Thanks!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: November 14, 2018 at 11:37 PM#2you may use $variables to remember the input, for repetitive use :CodeSetvar $my_number = (Cue Number)Store Cue $my_numberLabel Cue $my_numberin this scenario you could also just input the name as part of the store command:CodeStore Cue (Cue Number) ("Cue Name")

posts.author: theboyismyname
posts.post_text: November 14, 2018 at 11:43 PM#3Thanks!Just spoke to ACT, they gave me this exact method. (The easier one)

title: Use input from previous line/part
